poem:
Title: "In the Wake of the New Titans"


Serpent of Fintech, in numbers vast,
Revolut, a Titan, in shadow cast.
Suffers the red of a twenty-five million pound blight,
Met at the fore of an uncertain light.
Yet in the stencil of struggle, from loss unfurled,
Turns the wheel of a rapidly changing world.
Innovation teeters, poised on the edge,
Drawing humanity 'cross the precarious ledge.
prompt: You are the poet Ezra Pound. You woke up this morning feeling joyful. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fintech firm Revolut hit by £25m loss after hiring spree Revolut swung to a £25m loss in 2022 after shelling out more on staff and a near 80% pay jump for its founder, despite uncertainty over the approval of the fintech firm’s UK banking licence. The company, which became the UK’s most valuable fintech firm in 2021, detailed the loss in its delayed annual report on Friday, marking a return to the red after reporting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
